Class ExerciseFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • ExerciseFunctions
  • public class ExerciseFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    This exercise involves implementing several methods. Stubs for each method with documentation are given here. It is your task to fill out the code in each method body so that it runs correctly according to the documentation. You can run this file by compiling TestFunctions1.java It will call this program and run it, validating the test you choose. Example inputs with output are provided in the comments before each method. At a minimum, your solutions must pass these tests. Adapted by Robert Lightfoot from an exercise by Bruce Gooch.

    • Method Detail

      • isWet

        public static boolean isWet​(java.lang.String firstString,
                            java.lang.String secondString)
        Deciding is Water is Wet is a challenge. This code only determines if both values are wet. isWet("wet", "wet") returns true isWet("wet", "water") returns false isWet("water", "wet") returns false isWet("any-string", "any-string") returns false
        Parameters:
        firstString - String,
        secondString - String,
        Returns:
        true only if both input strings are "wet".

      • winCondition

        public static boolean winCondition​(java.lang.String original)
        Takes a string as input and returns true if it starts with "w"
        Parameters:
        original - String,
        Returns:
        true only if string starts with "w"

        Returns:

        public static boolean isNice​(java.lang.String firstString,
                             java.lang.String secondString)
        if either of the input strings are "nice", function returns true
        Parameters:
        firstString - String
        secondString - String
        Returns:

      • sameLastDigit

        public static boolean sameLastDigit​(int firstNumber,
                                    int secondNumber)
        This method campares the last digit of two non-negative digits, and returns true if the last digits are identical, false vice versa.
        Parameters:
        firstNumber - the first one of the two numbers to be compared
        secondNumber - the second one of the two numbers to be compared
        Returns:
        the result of comparison

      • lovesYou

        public static java.lang.String lovesYou​(java.lang.String original)
        Method returns values in the string "x loves you" when given a string of form "I love x" If nothing is sent in as a parameter or the parameter does not match style, then returns "Fred Rogers 143"
        Parameters:
        original - the String sent to function to be evaluated
        Returns:
        the resulting string after modifications are made

      • catch22

        public static java.lang.String catch22​(java.lang.String original)
        remove whitespace that occurs at the beginning or end of input string if 22 occurs at the beginning or end of input string
        Parameters:
        original - String
        Returns:
        the original string without 22 in it and remove whitespace at the beginning or end of the string only if 22 is found at the beginning or end

      • formalWords

        public static java.lang.String formalWords​(java.lang.String original)
        [This function takes in a sentence and capitalizes the first word of each sentence]
        Parameters:
        original - [This function takes in the original sentence as a parameter]
        Returns:
        [This function returns the sentence as a String with the first characters of each word capitalized.]

        public static java.lang.String deleteArticles​(java.lang.String original)

        Parameters:
        original - [It takes the original phrase as a sentence.]
        Returns:
        [Returns the phrase as a String with articles removed.]
